[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:centered-header-bhl]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:toggle-sidebar-bhl]]

[[include :scp-wiki:component:acs-animation]]

[[module css]]

 #page-title{
     display: none;
}

[[/module]]

[[div class="meta-title"]]
Exploratory Mission 7354 Delta
[[/div]]

As manned exploration of SCP-7354's interior is disallowed,[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Refer to logs of Exploratory Mission 7354 Alpha and Exploratory Mission 7354 Beta.[[/span]] the ontologically-sealed submersible used in Exploratory Mission 7354 Delta was piloted by Verne.aic. Its footage broadcasting capabilities were disabled immediately prior to launch;[[span class="fnnum"]].[[/span]][[span class="fncon"]]Refer to logs of Exploratory Mission 7354 Beta and Exploratory Mission 7354 Gamma.[[/span]] Verne.aic was instructed to describe what it saw through its cameras textually.

@@ @@

[[div class="blockquote"]]

**DAY 1:** Due to the spatially anomalous nature of SCP-7354, I have elected to measure my progress in days rather than meters, as that appears to be a more reliable metric. Nothing of note has yet taken place; I continue to travel downwards.

**DAY 2:** Nothing of note took place.

**DAY 3:** The color of the surrounding blood appears to be darkening in hue. It has gone from a deep crimson to a shade of almost brown. I know it's not due to lack of natural light, as I have long passed that threshold.

**DAY 4:** The blood continues to darken. It's closer to black, now.

**DAY 5:** Nothing of note took place.

**DAY 6:** The blood has become completely black. It seems to almost swallow up the light my floodlights produce.

**DAY 7:** Nothing of note took place.

**DAY 8:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 9:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 10:** I've started to see little motes of light in the distance. I tried to follow one, but it never appeared to get any closer. They remind me of something, but I can't figure out what.

**DAY 11:** Nothing of note again, but at least I have something to look at now.

**DAY 12:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 13:** I remember what it was: I compared the lights with photos in my internal database. The motes around me are a 1-to-1 match to the stars in the night sky, transposed into 360 degrees. If my instruments did not inform me that I was, in fact, still within a body of liquid, I might mistake my environs for the Void of space.

**DAY 14:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 15:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 16:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 17:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 18:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 19:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 20:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 21:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 22:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 23:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 24:** Nothing of note.

**DAY 25:** Nothing of note.

[[collapsible show="  			   " hide="  			   "]]**{{[DATA LOST]:}}** I understand now. They weren't stars at all.[[/collapsible]]

[[/div]]

@@ @@

[[include component:image-block
| name=omen.png
| caption={{[CONTEXT EXPUNGED]}}
| width=100%
| align=center]]

@@ @@
author: MontagueETC
